item.title: How to move Docker's data directory to an NTFS filesystem
item.description: I’m running out of disk space on my laptop. I use Ubuntu as my workhorse installed on a 120GB SSD. I also have a Windows OS on dual boot just in case I need it (I very very seldom do) which means my 1TB HDD needs to be NTFS (unfortunately) so I can use the disk from any OS. Now as the projects at work pile up, Docker seems to taking up most of the space of my poor little SSD.
